main event: A bright star-like object was observed in the sky over Buffalo, New York on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object made several erratic movements and appeared to increase and decrease in size,The sighting lasted for 21 and a half minutes,No sound was heard during the observation,The object was initially thought to resemble Venus, but the conclusion was not confirmed to be of interplanetary origin,The object moved erratically over a distance of 13.13 miles.
